features: 【Wireless Bluetooth Connection】Easily and quickly connect the printer to your phone via wireless Bluetooth. Simply download and install the specified app, turn on the printer and put the printer papers, and then connect via bluetooth.

【Multifunctional Inkless Printer】Our inkless pocket printer is perfect for printing memos, labels, black and white pictures, lists, records and more, meet various needs in your life. Suitable for various applications such as office, school, amateur archivists or treasure moms.

【Abundant Roll Paper】Mini Printer comes with thermal print paper that 5 roll of white paper, 2 roll of self-adhesive printable stickers, 3 rolls of colored paper and 5 color pen. You can create colorful and lovely patterns for crafting, scrapbooking or simply adding a touch of personalization to your belongings.

【Small and Lightweight】Pocket printer size is 83 x 83 x 40 mm/ 3.3 x 3.3 x 1.6 inches, and the thermal papers size is 57 x 25 mm/ 2.2 x 0.98 inches. Pocket printer is lightweight and compact, you can easily carry it in your pocket or bag whether you're using it at home, at the office or on the go.

【Ideal Gift for】Mini printer is the perfect gift for kids and students during festivals, Christmas, New Year, and birthdays. It's a fun and educational tool that they'll love to use and show off to their friends. Plus, with the included paper rolls, they'll have everything they need to get started right away!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: With its portable size, powerful app, and multifunctional capabilities, this mini pocket printer is the perfect gift for kids and students. Whether you need to print photos, notes, lists, or labels, this printer is easy to use and connects quickly to your smartphone via Bluetooth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A fun, portable printer
reviews.reviewText: LINGSFIRE Mini Portable Printer is well made and comes with plenty of extra paper. The printer itself charges quickly, is easy to load and lightweight. Plenty of paper rolls are included, even colored rolls. The instruction booklet includes a qr code for the easy to use phone app. It's portable, fun and can be used to print so many things.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Really, it’s awesome. U never need ink. Love that. Kiddos can play safe w it. (Not too young though… little markers to chew on)Lost one star bc u will need a certain determination to get it to connect to ur phone w the app. But, maybe someone can get it done quickly.I’ll want the big one now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Easy to print from app
reviews.reviewText: I was hoping to be able to print my already saved lists that were in my phone but couldn't. You can create new lists and documents to print and was easy to install app and didn't have any problems printing. The markers are very small and ink kept fading and even made a hole in the paper. It is a plus that it comes with a lot of paper to print on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun little B&W printer, the teen loves it
reviews.reviewText: The box arrived well packaged with instructions, a variety of extra paper rolls, sticker rolls and some small colored pens. I set the printer to charge via USB, and used the QR code in the instructions to download the app, which was quick and easy.The app is pretty intuitive. I found it easy to use, but be aware English is not the first language of the program writer, so there are typos and some items may not be labeled as expected.The teenager immediately found all the fun cartoons and art that can be used for messages, To Do lists and more.A couple drawbacks exist. - The first couple print attempts didn't advance and I had to fiddle with it and reload the paper a time or two before it finally "caught" and printed normally. It's been fine ever since. - The print quality for photos or more complex art can change as it prints - You must use the app to use the printer - you will have to learn it, and import anything into the app to print.All said though, it's a lot more silly fun than I expected. Also, the teen has claimed it and takes it to high school in their backpack pocket.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Tons of features and accessories, print quality will vary
reviews.reviewText: I've been trying to avoid getting named-brand printers because of the anti-consumer practices they engage in. As a result, I've mostly stuck with smaller, specialized devices for my printing needs. Something I didn't have was a small, inexpensive way to print labels, which I've always wanted to do. After a bit of research,I came across this little guy, which I think is a nifty, little device. Something I hated about most of the other printers that I saw was the interface. They all seemed to have tiny, low-res screens, and keyboards... and I much rather prefer something like this that uses an app. This is better for multiple reasons - my phone has a much bigger and better screen to work on, apps are easier to update if the developer wants to add features, no screen or keyboard on the device allows it to be smaller and lighter and less liable to break since it has fewer parts to rely on, and so on. As far as the features go, I like it a lot. Connecting the app to the printer was quick and easy to do, and I was able to print my first label within a minute or two. The app is also preloaded with lots of nice clip-art, and it even has categories that feature artwork dedicated to specific holidays. The printing kit itself comes with everything you need, and a whole lot extra. You get rolls of regular paper, sticky paper for labels, colored paper, and even colored markers if you want to add handwriting to your prints. There are a few shortcomings too. The app is sometimes not very intuitive in terms of its layout and the instructions were very clearly written by someone in which English was not their first language. I remember one particular process being a bit frustrating to deal with... in order to put custom text into my label, I had to double-tap the dragable box, but every time I did, it would interpret it as a drag-and-drop motion. So it would sometimes take between 5 and 10 attempts to get it right. Oh, there was also this weird glitch where the progress bar for a print-out would be stuck on 0% and only restarting the app would fix it. Also, the print quality, especially for photos, is not very great. I fully expected this to be the case before getting this, however. The labels look fine, and that's all I really care about. TLDR - Print quality will vary depending on what you use it for, some glitches with the app, but it's quick and easy to use and works well for what I need it for. 4/5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Decent, basic printer
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. First off, the instructions are tiny! Once I was able to squint enough to read them I was able to download the app needed to run the printer and get everything set up. I had no problems navigating the program and both selecting a photo from my gallery and a stock photo to print. The quality of the stock photo was good, but as you might imagine it was also a very basic line drawing. The quality of the photo from my gallery was... okay-ish. You can tell what it was, but it was grainy and pixelated. I tried one where I cropped and zoomed in, which made it better, but still not great. No where near the quality displayed in the listing photos. I don't know if it is capable of that type of quality.I haven't tried to run any stickers through it, but I have a larger thermal printer for that. I plan on letting my kids use this one to print photos from their tablet.This is an instance of you get what you pay for. This isn't a horribly expensive printer so you don't get horribly detailed photos.
